q: , Egypt's antiquities chief, toured the complex yesterday and expressed confidence it was sufficiently protected. Mr Zahi Hawass , who was appointed minister of state antiquities yesterday as part of the cabinet reshuffle, said: If the museum is safe, Egypt is safe. Looters were able to break into the museum on Friday, ripping the heads off two mummies and damaging about 75 small artefacts before soldiers caught them. Mr Zahi Hawass said the broken artefacts could be restored.
